Scrapes activity_data from FAOSTAT and slightly post-processes it

get_faostat_data.Rd

Important: Dynamically allows for the introduction of subsets as "...".

Note: overhead by individually scraping FAOSTAT code QCL for crop data; it's fine.

Usage

get_faostat_data(activity_data, ...)

Arguments

activity_data

activity data required from FAOSTAT; needs to be one of c('livestock','crop_area','crop_yield','crop_production').

...

can be whichever column name from get_faostat_bulk, particularly year, area or ISO3_CODE.

Value

data.frame of FAOSTAT for activity_data; default is for all years and countries.

Examples

"livestock" |>
  get_faostat_data() |>
  dplyr::sample_n(10)
#> Loading required package: FAOSTAT
#> Warning: Duplicated ISO3_CODE matched, double check the data
#> Warning: Certain ISO3_CODE were not matched.
#> Warning: Please check the correct China has been specified.
#>                   area               item element year        value unit
#> 1                 Cuba    Swine, breeding  stocks 2012 1.545100e+05   An
#> 2               Sweden             Horses  stocks 2020 1.050040e+05   An
#> 3             Bulgaria Chickens, broilers  stocks 1986 2.123200e+07   An
#> 4            Nicaragua             Cattle  stocks 2021 5.501018e+06   An
#> 5          Saint Lucia             Horses  stocks 1983 1.000000e+03   An
#> 6  European Union (27)      Swine, market  stocks 2000 1.390762e+08   An
#> 7   Belgium-Luxembourg             Horses  stocks 1964 2.366000e+05   An
#> 8                Nauru      Swine, market  stocks 1963 9.675000e+02   An
#> 9           Micronesia            Buffalo  stocks 2020 2.654054e+02   An
#> 10               Malta              Goats  stocks 1985 5.000000e+03   An
#>    ISO3_CODE
#> 1        CUB
#> 2        SWE
#> 3        BGR
#> 4        NIC
#> 5        LCA
#> 6       <NA>
#> 7       <NA>
#> 8        NRU
#> 9        FSM
#> 10       MLT
"livestock" |>
  get_faostat_data(year = 2010, area = "Portugal") |>
  dplyr::sample_n(10)
#> Loading required package: FAOSTAT
#> Warning: Duplicated ISO3_CODE matched, double check the data
#> Warning: Certain ISO3_CODE were not matched.
#> Warning: Please check the correct China has been specified.
#>        area               item element year    value unit ISO3_CODE
#> 1  Portugal      Swine, market  stocks 2010  1725300   An       PRT
#> 2  Portugal              Swine  stocks 2010  1917000   An       PRT
#> 3  Portugal   Chickens, layers  stocks 2010  6500000   An       PRT
#> 4  Portugal      Poultry Birds  stocks 2010 34464878   An       PRT
#> 5  Portugal            Turkeys  stocks 2010  2231878   An       PRT
#> 6  Portugal             Cattle  stocks 2010  1447000   An       PRT
#> 7  Portugal      Cattle, dairy  stocks 2010   243000   An       PRT
